title: Understanding Our Soil: The Nitrogen Cycle Fixers and Fertilizer

subtasks: Recognize that nitrogen makes up most of Earth's atmosphere but is unusable by plants in its natural form
Identify bacteria's role in breaking atmospheric nitrogen into reactive forms like ammonium, nitrite, and nitrate
Understand fungi's symbiotic relationship with plants in exchanging nutrients and carbohydrates
Realize how nitrogen exits the soil through crop harvest, erosion, and gaseous loss
Recognize the importance of loose soil organisms in the nitrogen cycle versus nitrogen in plants and organic matter
Contrast the environmental impacts of natural nitrogen fixation vs. synthetic fertilizers
Comprehend that healthy soil contributes to better plant nutrition and agriculture sustainability
Consider the role of nitrogen-fixing plants like peas, beans, and clover in supporting soil health and nutrient cycling
